what: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
title: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
Internal R for the Rest of Us package
Internal R for the Rest of Us package
text: function returns named vector colors used R Rest Us plots, elsewhere. based website: Blue - #6caadd : blue logo Dark Text - #314D63 : dark blue text colour website Light Text - #8394A1 : lighter variant dark blue text color Pale Blue - #E1EEF8 : pale blue based logo blue, currently used gridlines
code: rfortherestofus::rru_colors() ##       Blue  Dark Text Light Text  Pale Blue  ##  "#6caadd"  "#314D63"  "#8394A1"  "#E1EEF8" rfortherestofus::rru_colors("Dark Text", "Pale Blue") ## [1] "#314D63" "#E1EEF8"

title: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
text: uses font “Inter”, available via Google Fonts. Make sure install device import R making use theme.
code: library(tidyverse)  palmerpenguins::penguins |>   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = bill_length_mm,                  y = flipper_length_mm,                  color = species,                  size = body_mass_g)) +   labs(title = "Perfectly proportional penguins",        subtitle = "Just *look* at them go!",        x = "Bill length (mm)",        y = "Flipper length (mm)") +   colorblindr::scale_color_OkabeIto() +   guides(size = "none") +   rrutemplates::theme_rru() palmerpenguins::penguins |>   ggplot(aes(x = 1,              fill = species),          stat = "count") +   geom_bar() +   xlim(c(-0.5, 2)) +   coord_polar(theta = "y") +   labs(title = "Perfectly proportional penguins",        subtitle = "Look at them go!",        caption = "Data from {palmerpenguins}") +   colorblindr::scale_fill_OkabeIto() +   rrutemplates::theme_rru(void = TRUE) +   theme(legend.position = "right",         plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

what: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: function downloads files matching specified pattern GitHub repository, loads data frame, optionally deletes temporary directory used downloading.

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
code: load_obtn_data(   pattern,   dest_path = "temp/",   verbose = FALSE,   delete_temp_dir = TRUE )

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: pattern character string specifying pattern match file names. dest_path character string specifying destination directory downloaded files. Default "temp/". verbose logical value indicating whether print messages download process. Default FALSE. delete_temp_dir logical value indicating whether delete temporary directory loading data. Default TRUE.

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: data frame containing combined data matching files.

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
Title — number_half_up
Title — number_half_up
code: number_half_up(   x,   accuracy = NULL,   scale = 1,   prefix = "",   suffix = "",   big.mark = " ",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )

title: Title — number_half_up
text: accuracy number round . Use (e.g.) 0.01 show 2 decimal places precision. NULL, default, uses heuristic ensure breaks minimum number digits needed show difference adjacent values. Applied rescaled data. scale scaling factor: x multiplied scale formatting. useful underlying data small large. prefix Additional text display number. suffix applied absolute value style_positive style_negative processed prefix = "$" yield (e.g.) -$1 ($1). suffix Additional text display number. big.mark Character used every 3 digits separate thousands. default (NULL) retrieves setting number options. decimal.mark character used indicate numeric decimal point.  default (NULL) retrieves setting number options. trim Logical, FALSE, values right-justified common width (see base::format()). ... arguments passed base::format().

title: Title — number_half_up

text: accuracy number round . Use (e.g.) 0.01 show 2 decimal places precision. NULL, default, uses heuristic ensure breaks minimum number digits needed show difference adjacent values. Applied rescaled data. scale scaling factor: x multiplied scale formatting. useful underlying data small large. prefix Additional text display number. suffix applied absolute value style_positive style_negative processed prefix = "$" yield (e.g.) -$1 ($1). suffix Additional text display number. big.mark Character used every 3 digits separate thousands. default (NULL) retrieves setting number options. decimal.mark character used indicate numeric decimal point.  default (NULL) retrieves setting number options. trim Logical, FALSE, values right-justified common width (see base::format()). ... arguments passed base::format().

Convert HTML to PDF with paged.js — render_pagedjs_pdf
text: file_path character string specifying path HTML file Quarto document dest_path character string specifying destination directory file saved. Default file_path (using .pdf instead .html) delete_html_if_quarto Whether delete intermediate html file file_path Quarto document. Default TRUE.

title: Convert HTML to PDF with paged.js — render_pagedjs_pdf
text: input file (file_path) Quarto document, first generate HTML convert PDF. also option remove ot intermediate file.

title: Convert HTML to PDF with paged.js — render_pagedjs_pdf
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ render_pagedjs_pdf("file.html") render_pagedjs_pdf("file.html", "output.pdf") render_pagedjs_pdf("file.qmd") render_pagedjs_pdf("file.qmd", "output.pdf") render_pagedjs_pdf("file.qmd", "output.pdf", delete_html_if_quarto = FALSE) } # }

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
text: Remember install import required fonts ("Inter") using !

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
code: theme_rru(   show_grid_lines = TRUE,   show_legend = TRUE,   base_family = "Inter",   title_family = "Inter",   axis_family = "Inter",   void = FALSE )

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
text: show_grid_lines Boolean indicate whether grid_lines (TRUE default) show_legend Whether show legend (TRUE default) base_family Base font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. title_family Title font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. axis_family Axis text title font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. void logical, use TRUE want plot use theme_void() starting point (.e. want axes)

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru

what: Create or overwrite an air.toml configuration file — use_air_toml
title: Create or overwrite an air.toml configuration file — use_air_toml
text: Generates air.toml .air.toml configuration file formatting options air code formatter. default, writes new file unless overwrite = TRUE specified. Install R editor .

title: Create or overwrite an air.toml configuration file — use_air_toml
code: use_air_toml(   line_width = 80,   indent_width = 2,   indent_style = "space",   line_ending = "auto",   persistent_line_breaks = "true",   exclude = "[]",   default_exclude = "true",   skip = "[]",   file_name = "air.toml",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Create or overwrite an air.toml configuration file — use_air_toml
text: line_width Integer. Maximum line width. Default 80. indent_width Integer character. Indentation width. character, wrapped quotes. Default 2. indent_style Character. Indentation style, either "space" "tab". Default "space". line_ending Character. Line ending style. Can "auto", "lf", "crlf", "cr". Default "auto". persistent_line_breaks Character ("true" "false"). Whether preserve existing line breaks. Default "true". exclude Character. TOML array paths/patterns exclude. Default "[]". default_exclude Character ("true" "false"). Whether use default exclusion rules. Default "true". skip Character. TOML array paths/patterns skip. Default "[]". file_name Character. Name configuration file. Must "air.toml" ".air.toml". Default "air.toml". overwrite Logical. Whether overwrite existing file. Default FALSE.

title: Create or overwrite an air.toml configuration file — use_air_toml
